page.title: 13BELLS AND RINGERS IN WILDEN.
page.content: St. Nicholas Bell Tower contains five bells. Largest weighs 11.5 cwts. All cast in the note F. Oldest bell, cast 1460, inscribed with KATERINA ORA PRO NODIS. They're rung every Sunday. Present Captain, Mr.R.W.Ruff, started ringing in 1923. Became Captain 1936. In l981, ballbearings were fitted to bells, costing Â£606.05p paid for solely by the ringers.They have always been aware of need to keep bells in good condition. Each Xmas, they go round the village ringing their hand- bells, raising money towards upkeep of the tower bells. Handbells were purchased 1928. Ringers gave 6d a week till enough for 12 bells. Protected by a statement signed by 3 original ringers to remind all future ringers of efforts that went into obtaining the handbells. They must never be disposed of in any way.
